title: Art Spiegelman: Maus - A Survivor's Tale
description: Maus: A Survivor&#039;s Tale is a memoir by Art Spiegelman, presented as a graphic novel. It recounts the struggle of Spiegelman&#039;s father to survive the Holocaust as a Polish Jew and draws largely on his father&#039;s recollections of his experiences. The book also follows the author&#039;s troubled relationship with his father and the way the effects of war reverberate through generations of a family. In 1992 it won a Pulitzer Prize Special Award. The New York Times described the selection of Maus for the honor: "The Pulitzer board members ... found the cartoonist&#039;s depiction of Nazi Germany hard to classify.
